intro: Gynopleura rugosa, commonly known as the rough gynopleura, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed schizocarps, typical of the carrot family. Gynopleura rugosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
